abstract_summ: This protocol would allow to extend SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis to basic molecular biology laboratories with a great impact on surveillance programs at developing countries.We developed a triplex, real-time reverse transcription PCR for SARS-CoV-2 that maintained clinical performance compared with CDC singleplex assay.SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis is based on RT-qPCR protocols that limited testing to facilities with Real Time PCR devices and probes supply.Here we described and adapted version of the RT-qPCR CDC protocol where N1, N2 and N3 primers are used for end point PCR and amplicons are visualized on agarose gel with a limit of detection up to 20 viral RNA copies/uL.This protocol could speed up detection and save reagents during current SARS-CoV-2 testing supplies shortage.
title_summ: Evaluation of a quantitative RT-PCR assay for the detection of the emerging coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 using a high throughput systemEvaluation of a high-speed but low-throughput RT-qPCR system for SARS-CoV-2 detectionHigh sensitivity CDC EUA SARS-CoV-2 kit-based End Point-PCR assay.Sample pooling on triplets to speed up SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis using CDC FDA EUA RT-qPCR kit.Triplex Real Time RT-PCR for N1, N2 and RP probes from CDC EUA SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis kit.
title_abstract_phrases: High sensitivity CDC EUA SARS-CoV-2 kit-based End Point-PCR assay.This protocol could speed up detection and save reagents during current SARS-CoV-2 testing supplies shortage.Here we described and adapted version of the RT-qPCR CDC protocol where N1, N2 and N3 primers are used for end point PCR and amplicons are visualized on agarose gel with a limit of detection up to 20 viral RNA copies/uL.Triplex Real Time RT-PCR for N1, N2 and RP probes from CDC EUA SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis kit.SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis is based on RT-qPCR protocols that limited testing to facilities with Real Time PCR devices and probes supply.
